item.title: The Monty Hall Problem
item.description: I discuss a solution to the Monty Hall Problem discussed in the lecture. There are many ways to think of this problem and a thorugh discussion can be found here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monty_Hall_problem. Game Rules: Pick a door. One door has a prize behind it, say a car, the other two contain just “goats”. (Some people might prefer a goat over a car, me included. I just stick with the original formulation here, so let’s just say the goat is a symbol for not getting anything and the car a symbol for a prize we actually like to have).
